data.title: For Sale: 1960 Lotus 18 Formula Junior
data.meta_description: Club member Graham has his recently-finished 1960 Lotus 18 Formula Junior up for sale. Read on for the details.
data.text:
Calling all Southerners (and those who feel like a drive)! On the second Sunday of each month, we hold a Tyre Kick & Coffee at By the Bay Cafe in Carss Park from 8:30am. Come along and say ‘Hi!’

We meet on the second Sunday of the month at By the Bay Cafe in Carss Park, on Carwar Avenue in Blakehurst. As the name suggests, the cafe has scenic views over the water. It’s easy to access from the south, being a couple of km north of Tom Uglys Bridge, and a parking area is available for us to decorate. We look forward to seeing you there from 8.30am on.

Our regularly-scheduled Tyre Kick & Coffee at Kokoda Cafe remains as such, and will continue to be held a week later on the third Sunday of the month.

From March 17, we’re returning to Gough Whitlam Park in Earlwood for the second of our two Tyre Kick & Coffee meet-ups.

With the action at Gough Whitlam Park subsided, we’re heading back to the location for our Tyre Kick on the third Sunday of each month, with the possibility that Kokoda Cafe may be operational again in the coming months.

On the third Sunday of each month we get together to enjoy each other’s company over a morning coffee and some tyre kicking. To provide a location in our city’s north, the second of our two meetings is held on the third Sunday of the month.

Our Tyre Kick is a relaxed get together that sees us catching up from 9:00am to chat about life, cars and everything for an hour or two.

You are invited to enter round 4 of the 2024 CSCA Super Sprint Series, hosted by Club Lotus Australia on Sydney Motorsport Park’s Gardner GP Circuit on Saturday the 24th August 2024. Entries are open now on the Motorsport Australia Event Portal and will close on the 19th of August. Click here to enter.

Entry fee: $280.00 + dorian hire: $20.00. Payment is by credit card only through the MA event portal (transaction fee to be absorbed by Club Lotus Australia).

Minimum License Required: Current Motorsport Australia Speed/Speed Junior Licence or superior.

Please complete your event entry on the Motorsport Australia member portal by clicking this link.

Please read the supplementary regulations, available for download below:

CSCA 2024 Round 4 Supplementary Regulations [PDF]

Additionally, when entering the event you must complete, sign and scan the following two Motorsport Australia documents, and send them to motorsport@clublotus.com.au:

Motorsport Australia Disclaimer [PDF]

Self-Scrutiny Statement of Vehicle Compliance [PDF]

When entering the event on the Motorsport Australia portal, please ensure that:

Your CSCA reserved number is updated, otherwise you will be allocated a number

Your lap time for this and other circuits are entered and up to date. A guide to assist with this process is provided in the supplementary regulations. This information is needed for us to allocate you an appropriate run group

Please also note that as this super sprint is part of the CMC/Shannons weekend at SMP, garages are not available for competitors as stall holders for Sunday’s event will be setting up. Carports will be available on a first come first served basis

If you have any questions the motorsport committee team can be contacted by reply here or at motorsport@clublotus.com.au.

I look forward to receiving your entry and welcoming you on the day.

Brett Stevens,

Event Secretary
